messages: 83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:23): I am thoroughly fucked up
5ea45bee6f56ed606858a9acb688333f (10:32): sleeping too little?
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:32): enough drugs to take down a horse, and I still can't sleep.
d1987796df25df13abd3f572a0803319 (10:33): Maybe if you stopped your equine abuse, you might rest easy
d1987796df25df13abd3f572a0803319 (10:34): I wish more pharmaceutical researchers would say not that they experiment on animals for the good of mankind, but to hurt the animals - for fun
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:39): I'm really digging keen shoes
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:40): i have some keens, wouldn't call them shoes... more like sandals
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:40): sandals with a toe cap
d1987796df25df13abd3f572a0803319 (10:40): Do you know how many cows died for those shoes, which you don't need?
d1987796df25df13abd3f572a0803319 (10:40): Not nearly enough
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:41): they are great for light hiking.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:41): t'sok, the cows were probably beefsteak anyways.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:41): actually, you can get keens that are all synthetic too.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:41): cordoba outers
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:41): they're way better than sneakers/tennis/gym shoes
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:41): and they make keens that aren't like sandals.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:42): yes and no.     doing active stuff on sandy/gravelly surfaces, you get shit under your feet,  ;-/
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:42): i like my merrills 'ventilator' hiking boots when it gets a bit rougher.
d1987796df25df13abd3f572a0803319 (10:42): Perhaps you should not shit while you walk, no matter how clever it seems
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:43): peerce: not in these: http://www.keenfootwear.com/pdp_page.cfm?productID=56
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:43): http://www.keenfootwear.com/pdp_page.cfm?productID=159
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:44): I HATE FLASH SITES
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:44): I have these, http://www.keenfootwear.com/pdp_page.cfm?productID=41
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:45): wait, no, that was broken
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:45): fuck, its bringing up the wrong shoe.  stupid webpile
d1987796df25df13abd3f572a0803319 (10:45): There is one good Flash site
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:45): I wear these daily: http://www.keenfootwear.com/pdp_page.cfm?productID=21
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:46): GOD this site is broken
d1987796df25df13abd3f572a0803319 (10:46): But do you wear these: http://www.shockabsorber.co.uk/bounceometer/shock.html
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:46): yeah, mine are the newports, but when I click on it, I'm getting the ashland.  wtf?
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:47): newport originals, not h2 (h2 are the synth version)
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:48): very comfy to wear to work
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:48): and very handy in Arizona
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:49): considering how rough the terrain is everywhere
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:49): I love these for more serious hiking, http://www.merrell.com/Shop/Detail.aspx?NavID=FT-O-MLT&PID=9712
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:49): the breeze goes right through them, yet they offer the support and protection of a light hiking boot
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:50): peerce: where are you in the world?
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:50): what kinda' hiking do you do?
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:50): mostly nothing too serious, once in awhile I'll go for a good walkabout, however
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:50): ever do geocaching?
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:50): I like to mtn bike too, but don't do it often enough.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:50): thats on my list of things-to-do, but first I need to buy a Garmin 60CSx
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:51): all good stuff to do in Az.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:51): there's a bazillion geocaches near me
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:51): the only thing I don't like is that there's no water to hike around in Phoenix.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:51): real active caching community
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:51): go ahead, put 123W 39N into the geocache site
d1987796df25df13abd3f572a0803319 (10:51): You walk to the local coffee shop
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:52): this is what I have: http://www.garmin.com/products/nuvi/
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:52): ooops, I mean, 122W, 37N, hahahahaha.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:52): i want the 60CSx, did a bunch of research.  wanna use it on my motorcycle as well as hiking
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:52): The nuvi is good for both.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:53): http://www.gpsnow.com/gmmap60csx.htm
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:53): this is better :D
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:53): for offroad sure, but not for onroad.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:53): full autorouting, plus full marine chart support, plus good for hiking/topo/geocaching.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:54): yes.  its got full autorouting, can put a 2GB mSD flashcard in it
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:54): street navigator USA
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:54): I really dig the nuvi.  touch screen.  good for onroad mostly but works good enough offroad for geocaching.
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:54): I can load maps and junk.  audio books for the road, mp3's etc
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:55): i dislike touchscreens
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:55): prefer a good set of nav buttons once you learn and get used to something.
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:55): yea, it's not so hot for offroad, rough travel.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:55): the touchbuttons take up too much of the display most of the time
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:56): they're right on the screen and the maps go over them.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:56): or they are autohidden and navigating the menus takes longer
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:56): it's just a little box like.
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:56): yea.  but you don't navigate the menus while driving.  :)
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:56): youre not supposed to anyway.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:56): gpsnow has the MSRP $499 60CSx for $399, then there's $50 rebate
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:57): so $350.  i just need to convince my bookie-err-wife that I really need it :)
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:57): of course, then I need a 2GB flash card, and I need the CityNavigator USA and ...
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:57): if you're more active and NEEDING it, then sure.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:57): oh, and a motorcycle "RAM-mount"
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:57): so ride more & hike more.
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:57): hiking the woods in the autumn is awesome up there.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:58): she doesn't like the bike, and her idea of a hike involves the paved path along 'west cliff' here
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:58): take some coffee and muffins or something and have a romantic little hike in the woods.
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:58): well just don't go anyplace really rough.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:58): anywhere she wants to go, we don't need a GPS
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (10:59): now, SHE needs a navigation GPS in her car, but thats another story :D
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (10:59): I was just thinking if you got her out there more often, she might start to enjoy it like you do.
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (11:00): I like to hike along creeks and streams.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (11:00): one of these for her car, http://www.gpsnow.com/gmsp2820.htm, or http://www.thegpsstore.com/detail-lowrance-iway-350-car-gps.asp
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (11:00): and usually I'd just take a map & a compass.
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (11:00): which is why the nuvi is for my car.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (11:01): she used to like hiking more... she'd need to lose about 50 lbs to get back there.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (11:01): check out that Lowrance unit... its a touchscreen
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (11:01): well, taking walks with her is a good way to get her back in shape without saying, "You're getting hefty."
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (11:01): strictly a car gps
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (11:02): I still loves the nuvi.  :)
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (11:02): the lowrance has a much bigger screen
d1987796df25df13abd3f572a0803319 (11:03): Honesty is important in a relationship. Tell her that she's less attractive than the tub or lard she so closely resembles. She'll appreciate the feedback
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (11:03): and you might need that if your vision is fucked up.
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (11:04): the lowrance has the same size screen as the nuvi
83d33e760da347315c0063926f0e6248 (11:04): but it IS far less expensive.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (11:07): AJ_Z0; I bet your single, eh?
